intro: Chaptalia meridensis, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Chaptalia meridensis is known for its ability to thrive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It also serves as a host plant for certain species of butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
